page.title: 02St. Mewan C.P. School
page.content: St. Mewan County Primary School is set on the edge of St. Austell in gentle Cornish countryside. The children come mainly from the west side of the town and the surrounding villages. It is the largest primary school in Cornwall with 18 classes and 570 children currently on roll. St. Mewan is a traditional primary school with an infant section taking children from the age of four & a half and a junior section with children up to their 11th year when they transfer to one of the three local comprehensive schools. Including the Headmaster there are 20 staff.The school places great emphasis on the 3 R's and has a fine reputation for its sporting achievements. The school soon outgrew the original Victorian buildings and the extensions which began in the early 1960's were completed in 1972. (Avis Martin)
